#Text=Canada 's Davenport ( Ward 17 )
#Text=city council candidates speak
#Text=Saturday , November 4 , 2006
#Text=On November 13 , Torontoians will be heading to the polls to vote for their ward 's councillor and for mayor .
#Text=Among Toronto 's ridings is Davenport ( Ward 17 ) .
#Text=One candidates responded to Wikinews ' requests for an interview .
#Text=This ward 's candidates include Wilson Basantes Espinoza , Alejandra Bravo , Fred Dominelli , David Faria , Cesar Palacio ( incumbent ) , Cinzia Scalabrini , and Gustavo Valdez .
#Text=For more information on the election , read Toronto municipal election , 2006 .
#Text=Gustavo Valdez
#Text=48-year-old Gustavo Valdez is the publisher of a small magazine and " actor , character , artist " .

column1: #Text=Describe the three most important issues in your campaign .
#Text=a ) Community Safety and crime prevention
#Text=b ) Fair property taxes and improved city services
#Text=c ) Cleaner and Greener neighborhoods
#Text=What one election issue do you feel is most relevant to your ward in this election ?
#Text=Saint Clair Street Car right of way .
#Text=Even the neighborhoods oppose to it , I believe we have to do Saint Clair 22 century , however I will follow what the community wishes
#Text=Why have you chosen to involve yourself in the political process ?
#Text=For the tax problem then the community me his offered its support
#Text=Why do you want to represent this particular ward on council ?
#Text=Because its the ward were I live
#Text=How are you currently involved in the community ?
#Text=Trough my artistic side , singing and writing for them in my small publication .
#Text=Performing also my poetry .
#Text=I can not involve directly right know in the community local issues due I am a father of 2 children .
#Text=I care personally for them .
#Text=Which council decision ( since the 2003 election )
#Text=do you feel the city/your ward should be most proud of , and which was least desirable ?
#Text=In keeping going and growing , the least desirable is the growing homeless community
#Text=If you were elected as a " rookie " councillor , What would you bring to the table beyond the incumbent ?
#Text=The municipal government need to provide incentives and motivate entrepreneurship through tax cutting , low operating and administrative system of work .
#Text=It we 'll create jobs , revenue and wealth .
#Text=But we need to motivate the community .
#Text=We need more parks health centers , shelters and food banks .
#Text=Affordable housing at ward 17 and the entire city is essential .
#Text=Taxes on property should be cut of and utilities lowered .
#Text=Special attention should be put on low child care facilities to ease parents and allow them to work for the welfare of their families .
#Text=The family is the center of the society .
#Text=We look forward to defeat poverty .
#Text=More creational activities are necessary for the social isolated and disabled and people with special necessities .
#Text=Of woman is part of our agenda .
#Text=They need always attention .
#Text=We need to incentive the working class : They are the ones who construct the city , produce and keep the economy going .
#Text=Special attention for the working class is necessary .
#Text=I care for the environment , therefore we have to work for the greenhouse-gas emission problem and Kyoto Protocol .
#Text=Toronto is one of the most polluted cities in North America and we have to work on the air we breath free .
#Text=In building a great communities we build a great country .
#Text=And we have to prepare the country for the years to come to face the challenges of the future .
#Text=So education is important .
#Text=If we educate citizens we dot have to worry about crime and to spent money in unnecessary security and control , instead more education
#Text=more safe city , happy families therefore neighborhoods .
#Text=Let 's be prepare with vision for the future .
#Text=What does Toronto mean to you ?
#Text=It 's the city were I risen my kids , therefore I am interested in the city for the good will of the community and my family itself
